intro: Sterculia cuspidella, commonly known as the narrow-leaved sterculia, is a tropical evergreen tree native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The tree is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that are followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It is often found in lowland rainforests and is valued for its hard, durable wood. The plant also has traditional uses in local medicine and as a source of fiber.
